utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, this one's a little less made-up. The victim is the mother of the detective I’ve been following around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The case has been cold ten years. I just figured, since you're the best forensic pathologist in the city, maybe you could catch something they missed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Astronomical, I know. But I’d appreciate it if you took a look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course not. Thanks again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What was Dr. Death doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just a little consulting.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It sounded to me like you were looking into Detective Beckett's mother's murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Must you always eavesdrop?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I wasn't eavesdropping. I happened to walk by your office door. I live here, too, you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. I'm aware.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So does she know you're poking into her mother's case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's the sense in telling her until I find something new?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, you ever stop to think you're invading her privacy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm not poking through her underwear drawer. I'm investigating her mother's murder.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You are digging up her past, darling, without her permission. Now you either tell her or leave it alone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, my gosh, dad! Dad, dad, dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He asked me! Dad, he asked me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who asked you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Owen. But I told him I had to ask you. But you'll say yes, right? 'Cause I told him yes. But you have to say yes, so say yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What am I saying yes to?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The Junior-Senior prom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You are not a junior nor a senior.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: True, but Owen’s a junior.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Owen? I thought you said he was only 15.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he skipped a grade. But he's so cute, dad. Please, please, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I say yes, will you promise to stay up past your bed time, have a good time?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not - Not too good a time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, all we've done is hold hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ew, okay, please. Don't need details. Just...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So I can go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you can go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh! I love you. Oh! I'm gonna need a dress.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A beautiful dress. A dress, a dress, a dress! Thanks, dad!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So do you like this... Owen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't know. I haven't met him.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You are letting her go out with someone that you've never met? What kind of a father are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm not running a background check on your daughter's date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. She says he's quiet, he keeps to himself, and he lives with his parents. Tell me that doesn't sound like a serial killer to you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who's a serial killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle's daughter Alexis got invited to prom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's her first real date.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you're worried he's a serial killer? You should be more worried he's a teenage boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, he's only 15.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Between satellite TV and the internet, 15's the new 25.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude's right. I was 15 once.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still are.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If I had a daughter her age, I'd never let her out of the house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks, guys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Car was towed in a few hours ago - parking violations. When the attendant went to look for the VIN number, he found the vic slumped over with a bag on his head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Six parking tickets and a tow sticker, and no one bothers to look inside?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tinted windows, sunshade on the windshield.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You'd think someone would try to at least look inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, welcome to New York. You got an I.D.?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, Dr. Joshua Leeds, 37. According to the business cards in his wallet, he's a plastic surgeon. The car is also registered to him as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any money in the wallet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, couple of hundred bucks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess we can rule out robbery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A plastic bag and duct tape - Not a very efficient way to kill someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but it's very personal. All right, find and notify next of kin. Let's see how long he's been missing.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: From the state of decay, I’d say about a week.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That matches the date on the first parking ticket.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Preliminary cause of death indicates asphyxiation, but I’ll run toxicology just in case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That bag's pretty thin. Why wouldn't he just rip it off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must've been restrained.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That's only half the story. His fingernails were removed. And each finger presents signs of having been broken premortem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Broken?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If I had to guess, I’d say our doctor was tortured before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His fiancée, Courtney Mordant. She reported him missing a week ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C.S.U. Have any luck with the car?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They're running prints, testing fibers. We should have results by tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Morantz, I’m Kate Beckett. I'm the detective working on your fiancé's case... I'm very sorry about your loss. I was wondering if I could take a moment of your time.

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: I knew it. When he didn't come home, I just felt it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long were you engaged?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: Almost a year. We were gonna get married next month, at the Gardens. What did they want, money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn't appear to be a robbery.

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: Then why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was Josh involved in anything that might've brought him into contact with criminal elements?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: No. No, not my Josh. That's just not who he was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On the day he disappeared, did you notice anything different about him?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: Uh, different?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he seem worried or scared or distracted?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: He was fine. I mean, we were gonna meet, because we were gonna go taste some cakes. When he didn't show, I called the office and they said he'd left, so I called his cell phone, but he didn't pick up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If his office was in Midtown, do you have any idea why his car would be found on 133rd Street?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY MORANTZ
utterance.content: 133rd Street? He'd never go that far north. He always took the Midtown tunnel to the l.I.E. And if he was gonna be late, he'd call. He'd always call. He'd always let me know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything on the canvass?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nada. Locals only remember seeing the car after the tickets. No security cameras on the street.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fiancée's story checks out. Cake shop confirms she was there waiting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Heading to meet his fiancée at a cake shop in Great Neck, how'd he wind up dead on a street in Harlem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he had secrets even his fiancée didn't know about. Like maybe he secretly made a living out of using his surgeon skills to harvest organs off of tourists for the black market organ trade. Whoa, that was a good one. I'm writing that down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So instead of making up stories, we are going to establish a timeline. When did he get his first ticket?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Last Wednesday morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so you guys go to the Midtown garage where he kept his car, and we'll hit his office.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when do you ask permission to ask questions?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's about your mother's case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you ever thought about... reopening it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. I just thought if we worked together -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have resources.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you touch my mom's case, and you and I are done. Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don't you want to investigate it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same reason a recovering alcoholic doesn't drink. You don't think I haven't been down there? You don't think I haven't memorized every line in that file? My first three years on the force, every off-duty moment was spent looking for something someone missed. It took me a year of therapy to realize if I didn't let it go, it was gonna destroy me. And so I let it go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. I didn't know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, now you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this must be the place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it with men and boobs, anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's biological. We can't help it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But doesn't it bother you that they're so obviously not real?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Santa's not real. We still love opening his presents.

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT JULIA
utterance.content: It wasn't like him to disappear. I think that, deep down, we all knew that, um, that something was wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he seem agitated at all?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: No, I mean, it was pretty much business as usual.

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT MARIO
utterance.content: Except for the wedding. We were trying to clear his schedule for the honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Last Tuesday. He was on his way to meet his fiancée.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What time did he leave the office?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Um...

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Around 5:30.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT MAGGIE
utterance.content: When I called at 6:00, he was fine. He said he was in traffic at the tunnel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He'd left Manhattan then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would he come back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Dr. Leeds have any enemies, anyone that he had operated on who had had complications or a bad experience?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: None of his patients had complications.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: That doesn't mean that they were always happy. Cosmetic surgery is about self-image. For some people, it changes their lives. For others, nothing's ever enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did any of his patients ever threaten him?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: One. Jacey Goldberg. She was a patient of Dr. Leeds until about three months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: She wanted a face-lift.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: So she already had three, and Dr. Leeds refused to perform the operation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what'd she do?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: She sued him. It was thrown out of court, of course.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: That's when the threats started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: At the very least, she should be arrested for violating the laws of nature.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out - Jacey Goldberg’s husband Jack had her committed to Bellevue a month ago for psychiatric treatment for her little obsession.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guess who testified in support of her commitment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Joshua Leeds.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Mandatory 1-month treatment program. She was released last week.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Three days before our doctor went missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mentally unstable plastic surgery chick. That is way better than harvesting organs.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Get her in here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look at her. How can anyone do that to themselves?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? It's like she escaped from The Island Of Dr. Moreau.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, guys, she's not an animal. She's a human being.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, but... Wait, are you being sincere or quoting The Elephant Man? Oh. Saucy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Goldberg, I’m Detective Beckett. This is Richard Castle, a consultant with the department.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Goldberg, are you familiar with a plastic surgeon named Dr. Joshua Leeds?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You recently sued him for malpractice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "For refusing to perform elective cosmetic surgery, specifically a face-lift, facial implants and liposuction."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Leeds didn't seem to think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you wanted the surgery so badly, why didn't you just see another lips? Doc-Doctor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you threatened to ruin him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you killed him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Leeds was murdered last week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A couple of days after you were released from the psychiatric treatment facility that Leeds helped commit you to. That's motive and opportunity, counselor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then I suppose you won't mind telling me where you were last Tuesday night.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So where was she?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was... in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Getting more surgery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What's she got left to operate on?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yes.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Seriously? What could they possibly do down there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, apparently, quite a lot.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Ugh. But if Leeds had a reputation of turning people away, maybe there's someone else out there he pissed off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Esposito and Ryan are already looking through the patient list, but the C.S.U. came back clean from the car. It would be almost impossible for a run-of-the-mill revenge murderer to be that invisible.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You thinking it's professional?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Mrs. Goldberg had enough money to pay someone to do it, and her surgery is a pretty convenient alibi. But torture and suffocation? That doesn't seem like the work of a disgruntled trophy wife turning 50.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A surgeon with broken fingers? That's someone sending a message.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look beautiful.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you say that about every dress. Don't you think this makes my skin look pasty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetheart, I want you to know, no matter how you think you look, you are perfect exactly the way you are.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You're not helping.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, God. No. Hideous.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Here. Try this. All right. Good color for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "You look hideous"? Are you trying to give her body-image issues?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. News flash - She already has body-image issues. It's an intrinsic part of being a woman. Every woman in the world has some part of herself that she absolutely hates. Her hands are too small, her feet are too big, her hair's too straight, too curly, her ears stick out, her - Oh, God - Her butt's too flat, her nose is too big, and, you know, nothing you can say will change how we feel. What men don't understand is, the right clothes, the right shoes, the right makeup just - It - It hides the flaws we think we have. They make us look beautiful to ourselves. That's what makes us look beautiful to others.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Used to be... All she needed to feel beautiful was a pink tutu and a plastic tiara.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We spend our whole lives trying to feel that way again.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think it's you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Staff just went through all the files. No other red flags. Any dark secrets in here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah... Dr. Leeds had a weakness. Energy bars. He volunteered at Doctors International, did pro bono work. The guy's a Boy Scout. Hell, he didn't even have any porn on his computer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That's weird.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know. You know what he had in his locked desk drawer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A fifth of scotch?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check book. The guy locked up his check book.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about these folders?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wedding stuff - Tux deposits, catering invoices.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe some angry couple killed him for their wedding venue, hmm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's as good a theory as any.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. These aren't all wedding files.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's odd. All the patient information is blacked out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe Dr. Leeds has a secret after all.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: It's his handwriting, but... I've never seen this file before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you identify that patient?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Not from his notes. Just that it was a male, 55 years old.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How about this kind of procedure?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: This is impossible. I'm his primary nurse. I run his surgical team. He never operates without me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Apparently, he did.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Mario, check on Dr. Leeds' calendar. What do you have for March 18th?

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: He... was supposed to be down at Mercy attending a panel on reconstructive surgery.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Why would he lie? Why would he operate without me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to the hospital, the procedure lasted nine hours. Neither the assisting nor the anaesthesiologist were with the hospital. Both were brought in by Dr. Leeds. Neither of his regulars.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A 9-hour mystery operation he didn't want his own people to know about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hospital must've had some record of the patient.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get this - The hospital can't find the file. It's like it never happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who did you talk to?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Patient information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well... that was your first mistake. If you want to find someone at a hospital who had a treatment there, there's only one department to go to where nothing ever falls through the cracks. Billing. Someone had to pay for it, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. No, I appreciate it. Well, it looks like our mystery patient's hospital bills were paid promptly and in full.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By whom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wire transfer. Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See what you can find on this account number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So did Alexis find a dress yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. A cute one, too. Boy. I can't believe my little girl's going to prom. My only comfort now is the long-standing tradition of torturing the boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the time-honored hazing that goes on in those few moments we share, where he and I are alone just before my daughter descends the stairs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I remember the terror of meeting my date's old man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Checked my wallet for condoms, showed me his gun collection. My hands were shaking so bad, I could barely put on the corsage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What'd your dad do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I... I don't know. I was in my room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was your date when you finally came out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, actually, now that you mention it, he looked terrified. And this whole time, I thought he was scared of me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope. And now it's my turn.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you planning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something befitting the name of Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, you're never gonna believe this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What'd you find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That account the money was wired from? It belongs to the U.S. Attorney's office. Whatever the procedure was, Uncle Sam paid for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess we can rule out boob job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would the D.O.J. pay for a cosmetic procedure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There's only one reason. To change someone's identity.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you think the guy was in witness protection?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Dr. Leeds was tortured, I think our killer is trying to find this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we better find him first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you find someone who's in witness protection?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We ask the people who are protecting him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ask "Hard Candy"? Good luck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hard - Hard Candy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Assistant U.S. Attorney Candace Robinson. She makes mobsters cry.

utterance.speaker: CANDACE ROBINSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry, detective, but you must know that information on a protected witness is confidential. Whether or not you have proof that we employed Dr. Leeds or whether or not you have proof that an operation took place is irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not to my victim, it's not. Not to his family, and certainly not to his fiancée. They were planning a life together that they will never have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Robinson, doesn't it matter to you that the man that you employed was killed and whoever murdered him might be looking for your witness?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This witness of theirs is key. Without knowing who he is or who's after him, there's no way of getting to the next step.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's another way we could figure out who that witness is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Candace Robinson’s office deals almost exclusively with organized crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what if we ask the other side?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to ask the mob who the witness is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clearly, they already know who he is if they're trying to kill him. Like you said, he's got to be a significant witness in a pretty big case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we do, hop in the car, drive down to the Bada Bing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know a guy. He owes me a favor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You "know a guy"? What is this, a Mamet play?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the early days of Derrick Storm. He's a capo with one of the families. He's actually pretty nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For a criminal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm just saying, maybe he knows something. Maybe he can tell us something the feds won't. I keep forgetting you read plays.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Whoa! I'm-I'm a friend! I'm a friend.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Take him out back. Kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sal, whoa! Oh! Sal! Whoa, you're go - It's - It's me, buddy.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Vito! Vito, wait! Vito, wait! Hold up. I was just messing with him. Sorry, man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not funny, Sal.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Oh, you're right. No, it wasn't funny. It was frickin' hilarious! Richard frickin' Castle - Master of the macabre. Ha. What brings you down off your cloud of money?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: The guy you're talkin' about - He worked for the Spolano family. Jimmy "The Rat" Moran. He was an underboss. He was a favorite of the old man's, but he got squeezed out by junior when the old man bit it. Rumor has it that he turned state's a few months ago, and the Spolanos are running scared. Apparently, Moran’s got it all - bills of lading, calendars, ledgers, the whole shooting match. Enough to take down all the top guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, no wonder he wanted to change his face.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Hey, if they got to the surgeon, it's only a matter of time before they get to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When I wrote Storm Warning -

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Oh, I love that book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You told me that certain mob hit men have signature styles or weapons.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, this killer used a plastic bag with duct tape to suffocate his victim. Does that sound like anyone you know?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: You'd have to ask the Spolanos about that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don't think they'd like that.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Heh. Probably not. I bet you I know somebody else who might know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Jimmy The Rat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jimmy "The Rat" Moran, a.k.a Jimmy Pretty. He's been linked to gambling, loan sharking and extortion schemes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, you want a guy to be loyal, you probably shouldn't nickname him "The Rat."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let's start off by digging up all known associates of the Spolano family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, and while we're at it, we'll just bang our heads against a brick wall, you know, just for fun.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Professional hits are the hardest to close. Because of the anonymous nature of the murders, the usual rules like motive and relationship to victim don't apply.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to talk to Moran. Gotta see what he knows.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What makes you think your friend "Hard Candy" is going to cooperate with you now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have your sources. I have mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it's not your ex-boyfriend, is it? Mr. FBI - Tall, brooding and judgmental?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why, yes, in fact, it is. Is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not for me. But then again, I’m not the one he's trying to get back together with.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Well, this is a nice surprise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? Hopefully, this is a nice surprise as well.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Sprinkles. Am I really that predictable?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe I just know you too well. I mean, we did date once.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no, thanks. I don't eat sprinkles anymore.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Right. So, Kate, is this the part where you ask me to bend the rules to help you on your case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Am I really that predictable?

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Maybe I just know you too well. What do you need?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wanna talk to Jimmy Moran.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Jimmy Moran the mobster?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: What makes you think I can help with that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The FBI and the U.S. Attorney's office have him in witness protection.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: And you know this how?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Word on the street.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Look, even if it's true, I don't work organized crime cases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Will, you and I both know how this works. You reach out to the agent in charge, he talks to the A.U.S.A. running the case, and then I get to talk to Jimmy Moran.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: And I do this for you why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let me put this another way. The Spolanos know that Jimmy is cooperating with the government. We know that they want him dead because they murdered the surgeon you feds hired to change his face. You guys put that doctor in harm's way, so you're doing it for him, not for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is it. Don't be nervous.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad! No! No severed heads.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's - I - It's time-honored.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No! Richard... really.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Take it off. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Hi. Wow, you look, uh, really nice.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks. You, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baby, find the lens.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shh. Pretend I’m not here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, dad, gram, this is Owen.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Delighted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. A pleasure.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, don't they look adorable? And... a corsage.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Oh, uh, here. It, uh, it goes on your wrist.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh... It's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, ready? Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. Whoa, whoa, wait, wait, wait. Whoa, that's it? I don't even get a chance to ask him if he's killed a man?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, he hasn't, but I might.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, get outta here. Don't do anything I would do.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye! Enjoy yourselves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have fun! Goodbye!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh... oh...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My little girl - She's all grown-up.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, well, at least one of you is. A severed head?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, I was just getting started, too. I was gonna break into my Chris Walken. Whoa. Tell me, little man... Have you ever been to prison?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Very funny, very funny. But leave the acting to me, honey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. Detective Beckett. I'm so glad you called. Regale me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s my Chris Walken. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh... needs work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in - In all fairness, part of it's visual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Sorenson's onboard. He pulled some strings and got someone at the U.S. Attorney's office to cave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's gonna let you question Moran.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we gotta be there in an hour. Are you in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Am I in? Is the Pope Catholic?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It'll grow on you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, a parking garage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's... pretty cliché.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, no one said that the feds were original.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, next thing you'll tell me, they'll be pulling up in a black Suburban with tinted windows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, someone's been watching way too many Bruckheimer films.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The NYPD thanks you for your cooperation.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Want me to watch the monkey?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's okay. Monkey comes with me.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Suit yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I really like your car. It's very nondescript.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Moran, I’m detective Beckett. This is Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Richard Castle, like the novelist?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly like.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: I thought you guys were cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's consulting on the case.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Well, look, I already told the feds everything I know. You want info on the Spolanos, ask them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we're not here about the Spolanos. We're here about Dr. Leeds, the man who operated on you.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was found murdered last week.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Murdered? The doc was murdered?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Asphyxiated. They duct taped a plastic bag over his head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe the Spolanos may have been involved.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: "May have been"? "May have been"?!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Given how Leeds was killed and given your knowledge of the organization, we were hoping that you would be able to help identify the -

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Get me out of here!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can help, Mr. Moran. We can find the guys who did this, but you have to let me know if there was anyone in the Spolano family that kills this way.

utterance.speaker: MORAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, there is. Me. The duct tape, the bag - That was my M.O. Don't you get it? They're sending a message to me, and if they got to the doc... Take me back! Now!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, how'd it go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, do the words "unmitigated disaster" mean anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We scared a key witness in a huge federal case so bad that now he won't testify.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, is that all?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett. Just got a call from D.O.J.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I can explain-

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No, no. It's - It's Sorenson. On the way back to the FBI safe house with Moran, someone pulled up next to 'em and opened fire. He was in the back with the witness. They both were shot.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Car was a late-model sedan with dealer plates. The guy pulls up at a light with a mask on, blew the tires, starts shootin' at the back of the vehicle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought the glass would be bulletproof.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They used cop killers - Teflon rounds. Went right through the door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's still in surgery. Moran's gonna be okay, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to talk?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There's nothing to talk about. I'm the one who pushed for it, and I’m the one who got Will involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's no way you could have known this was gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that? Because their vehicle was attacked leaving our meet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we were followed. Someone who knew about the investigation found out about the meet. We led them to Moran. So yeah, I should've known. And if I were a better cop, I would've.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think this is your fault? Yeah, you pushed for it, not because it's your job, but because you care. Most people come up against a wall, they give up. Not you. You don't let go. You don't back down. That's what makes you extraordinary.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He's gonna make it. He's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: I, uh, I had a good time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Uh... good night.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you have fun?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I did. This dating thing is kind of nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was Owen? Don't worry. I closed my eyes for the kissing part.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. You know you didn't have to wait up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's my job. I wait up. I make sure you're all right. But tonight I realized I'm not going to be doing it for much longer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A couple years, you're gonna go off to college, you're gonna get married, you're gonna have kids, and I’m only gonna see you on holidays. Until some gold digger steals all my money, but then I get to move in with you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wow. I feel like I just lost 30 years of my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's how it happens. One day you're in tutus, and the next day you're... Too old for severed heads.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, don't worry. No matter how old I get, I'll always be your little girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Promise?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Promise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Now go to bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Desk officer said she came in at 4:00 this morning. She's been at the board ever since.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She called us in at 6:00 A.M. To recheck every person we talked to on the case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And she's had, like, nine double espressos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Been reading on the internet about this new thing called "sleep." Supposed to be real good for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ssssh. Sssh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When I gave you that little speech last night, I really didn't mean for you to go all Beautiful Mind on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It wasn't anyone at the U.S. Attorney's office. They wouldn't need us to find him. So it had to be someone that we talked to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don't think it was my mafia connection?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he's in a rival family, then they would want Moran alive to testify because if the feds take down the Spolanos, then the other families can take over their territories. No, we are looking for someone who had access to the doctor before we got the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that leaves the fiancée and his staff.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, except the fiancée is clean, alibied and accounted for last night. Phone records don't indicate any calls to unknown numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you already ran his staff up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We did, and there were no records of anything that indicate ties to organized crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about last night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maggie Dowd was at dinner with friends. Mario Guerrero worked late packing patient files, and the senior nurse, Julia Hammond, claims she was home alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was Mario doing packing patient files last night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They're closing up shop. Patient files are all going to new doctors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's just, doesn't that seem like a weird thing to be doing on a Friday night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, when you're low man on the totem pole, that's what life is like. People think they can call you in to work at 6:00 A.M. on a Saturday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Julia Hammond and Maggie Dowd - How long did they work for Dr. Leeds?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, Hammond was with him ten years. Maggie came on a few months back. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because our low man on the totem pole Mario Guerrero started working for the doctor about a month ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We checked him. We even called his nursing school. He's clean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check again. They can't all be clean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To see if Mario was actually at the office Friday night.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Detective. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mario, I need you to come with me.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to ask you some questions.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Did I do something wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's Maggie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maggie. We double-checked everything, even called the nursing schools again. This time we had 'em send pictures, and the one of Maggie... It's a different girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's Maggie. Where's Maggie Dowd?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: She didn't come in today. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is Dr. Leeds affiliated with St. Marcus Hospital?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Yeah. That's where we do our procedures.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If she has a hospital I.D.-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She can finish the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're off the hook... But don't leave town.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Oh. Room's restricted. Need to see your I.D.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: You have a Maggie Dowd on your list?

utterance.speaker: FEMALE GUARD
utterance.content: She's on the roster. You can let her through.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I gotta say, Jimmy, you're a hard man to find. Took me weeks to even find out that you changed your face. Sodium thiopental. It's what they use in lethal injections. It's not as much fun as a plastic bag... But it does the trick. Oh, and, uh, I got a message from Junior, Jimmy. . He says, "Go to hell."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. You're under arrest for the murder of Dr. Leeds and the attempted murder of Jimmy Moran.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You're too late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. Oh, God. Oh, don't worry. It's not attached to anything. It's like we knew you we were coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Attempted murder of a federal witness - What's that going for these days?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She's all yours.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Looks like you managed to set things right with the U.S. Attorney's office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She turned state's. When Moran recovers, the feds will have two witnesses against the Spolanos.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: But only Maggie back there can link them to murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, but her real name is Carla Dante. The call her "Carla Coldblood." She's been killing for the family for five years now. When Jimmy dropped the dime, the Spolanos sent their best.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Lady hit man - A real blow for women's rights. And the real Maggie Dowd?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Works for a hospital in Seattle. She had no idea that they had stolen her identity. Carla even pulled a recommendation off of a job-hunting site in order to apply for the position with Leeds. Originally she thought she was gonna get a photograph of Moran, and when she couldn't, she went after Leeds.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And then when Leeds didn't talk, she killed him. But why stay around the office?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If she left before Leeds' body was found, it would have looked suspicious, and she probably didn't think he'd be sitting around for a week. Then we showed up, and she waited to see how far we'd get.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That's good work, detective. Very good work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir. You know, sir, I never thought that I would be saying this, but... I don't think I could have done it without Castle.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Where is Castle, anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about these?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is sounding less like a random killing, more like a targeted murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were they related?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You have to tell her, you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know what this would do to her?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You have information that could lead to her mother's killer. You can't keep that from her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. But she said if I opened the file, that we'd be through.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It doesn't matter. She has to know.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: No, you didn't. Stop making me laugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on. It's not like you've been shot or something.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: I thought you were over sprinkles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe not.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: It's the writer monkey. What is he still doing here? Haven't you finished your book yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last chapter. Do you have a sec?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: Watch it, Kate. He likes you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You'll have to forgive him. He is heavily medicated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You look awfully serious. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take a seat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's about your mother.
